Interface IDnaStrand

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Character>

    public interface IDnaStrand
extends java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Character>
    Interface for DNA/strand experiments
    Author:
    Owen Astrachan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IDnaStrand append(java.lang.String dna)
      Append dna to the end of this strind.
      char charAt(int index) 
      IDnaStrand cutAndSplice(java.lang.String enzyme, java.lang.String splicee)
      Cut this strand at every occurrence of enzyme, essentially replacing every occurrence of enzyme with splicee.
      IDnaStrand getInstance(java.lang.String source)
      Return this object, useful to obtain an object without knowing its type, e.g., calling dna.getInstance() returns an IDnaStrand that will be the same concrete type as dna
      java.lang.String getStats()
      Returns a string that can be printed to reveal information about what this object has encountered as it is manipulated by append and cutAndSplice.
      void initialize(java.lang.String source)
      Initialize by copying DNA data from the string into this strand, replacing any data that was stored.
      IDnaStrand reverse()
      Returns an IDnaStrand that is the reverse of this strand, e.g., for "CGAT" returns "TAGC"
      long size()
      Returns the number of elements/base-pairs/nucleotides in this strand.
      java.lang.String strandInfo()
      Return some string identifying this class and internal tracked data, e.g., append calls.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • cutAndSplice

        IDnaStrand cutAndSplice(java.lang.String enzyme,
                        java.lang.String splicee)
        Cut this strand at every occurrence of enzyme, essentially replacing every occurrence of enzyme with splicee.
        Parameters:
        enzyme - is the pattern/strand searched for and replaced
        splicee - is the pattern/strand replacing each occurrence of enzyme
        Returns:
        the new strand leaving the original strand unchanged.

      • size

        long size()
        Returns the number of elements/base-pairs/nucleotides in this strand.
        Returns:
        the number of base-pairs in this strand

      • initialize

        void initialize(java.lang.String source)
        Initialize by copying DNA data from the string into this strand, replacing any data that was stored. The parameter should contain only valid DNA characters, no error checking is done by the this method.
        Parameters:
        source - is the string used to initialize this strand

      • getInstance

        IDnaStrand getInstance(java.lang.String source)
        Return this object, useful to obtain an object without knowing its type, e.g., calling dna.getInstance() returns an IDnaStrand that will be the same concrete type as dna
        Parameters:
        source - is data from which object constructed
        Returns:
        an IDnaStrand whose .toString() method will be source

      • strandInfo

        java.lang.String strandInfo()
        Return some string identifying this class and internal tracked data, e.g., append calls.
        Returns:
        a string representing this strand and its characteristics

      • append

        IDnaStrand append(java.lang.String dna)
        Append dna to the end of this strind.
        Parameters:
        dna - is the string appended to this strand
        Returns:
        this strand after the data has been added

      • reverse

        IDnaStrand reverse()
        Returns an IDnaStrand that is the reverse of this strand, e.g., for "CGAT" returns "TAGC"
        Returns:
        reverse strand

      • getStats

        java.lang.String getStats()
        Returns a string that can be printed to reveal information about what this object has encountered as it is manipulated by append and cutAndSplice.
        Returns:

      • charAt

        char charAt(int index)
